Each clashing player reveals the top card of his or her library, then puts that card on the top or bottom. A player wins if his or her card had a higher converted mana cost.

This phases in or out before you untap during each of your untap steps. While it's phased out, it's treated as though it doesn't exist.

Rather than cast this card from your hand, you may pay [cost] and exile it with four time counters on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a time counter. When the last is removed, cast it without paying its mana cost. It has haste.

Costs involving .
There can only be one World enchantment on the battlefield at a time.

Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are blocking or being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking
When you cast this spell, copy it for each spell cast before it this turn. You may choose new targets for the copies.

This creature can attack in a band as long as at least one has "bands with [factor]." Bands are blocked as a group. If at least two creatures you control, one of which has "bands with other [factor]," are blocking or being blocked by the same creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.
